uk.co.kennah.encrypt

Class SecureProperties

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.co.kennah.encrypt.SecureProperties

  • public class SecureProperties
extends java.lang.Object
    SecureProperties replaces the conventional Properties file by making use of the jasypt API to create an encrypted properties file. The password for unlocking the encrypted content is contained within the file BUT itself is encrypted.
    Author:
    Tony Kennah

    • Method Summary

      void store()

    • Method Detail

      • createSecureProperties

        public static SecureProperties createSecureProperties(java.lang.String filename)
                                               throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                                      java.io.IOException
        Returns a SecureProperties object that can then be used to store encrypted content. PaGen is used to generate a random password. createSecureProperties is the only way to instantiate a new secure properties

        If the filename passed to this static initialiser exists and contains Authentication Tokens (an encrypted password), the tokens found will be used. If the filename passed to this static initialiser exists and DOES NOT contain Authentication Tokens, the tokens will be produced. If the filename passed to this static initialiser doesn't exist a new file will be eventually be created containing tokens.

        Parameters:
        filename - the path\filename to be used
        Returns:
        the secure property file awaiting encrypted content
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - FNF
        java.io.IOException - IOE
        See Also:
        Properties

      • keySet

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.Object> keySet()
        keySet get the Set of keys
        Returns:
        returns the keyset from the underlying property list

      • setProperty

        public java.lang.Object setProperty(java.lang.String key,
                                    java.lang.String value)
        Set the property
        Parameters:
        key - String to be used as the key
        value - String to be used as the value for this key value pair
        Returns:
        the previous value of the specified key in this property list, or null if it did not have one.

      • setEncryptedProperty

        public java.lang.Object setEncryptedProperty(java.lang.String key,
                                             java.lang.String value)
        Set the property BUT make sure this is encrypted so we add this key to the java.util.List of encrypted contents / values
        Parameters:
        key - String to be used as the key
        value - String to be used as the value for this key value pair
        Returns:
        the previous value of the specified key in this property list, or null if it did not have one.

      • getProperty

        public java.lang.String getProperty(java.lang.String key)
        Get the property
        Parameters:
        key - String to be used as the key
        Returns:
        String which this key points at from the underlying property list.

      • store

        public void store()
           throws java.io.IOException
        store gets the property list ready for writing to disk and then calls the private internal writePropertiesFile method to actually write this list to permanent storage.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is a problem writing this file
